body: Hi all,  I am trying to simulate a Microshade using Honeybee instead of daysim. Below is the link to the document that explains how to run the Microshade simulation in daysim:  [http://www.photosolar.dk/userfiles/file/Dokumenter/Guideline%20to%2...](http://www.photosolar.dk/userfiles/file/Dokumenter/Guideline%20to%20daylight%20calculation_2013.pdf) On page 6 (picture below) it explains how to define the Radiance material of the Microshade. I am not sure how this could be done using Honeybee. I know that one can insert materials to the Radiance library but how is this done in this case I am not sure.  [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/poNlDA9JoO1fmDJ71bBBBi0OyHc7n7KPbjb8GpW1z1Yp5*XGPgB9KHgie8WQmsg0f*IA2rhQOEUlc2yVnKFyd8oOUbi0y140/1.PNG) Can you guys help me with this? Thanks,  Alejandro
